Amritmahal.description: Legendary draft breed from Karnataka, originally bred for war transport. Known for immense stamina and speed.
Amritmahal.diet: Forest grazing, Ragi straw, Horse gram, Natural pasture grasses.

Bachaur.description: Draft breed from Sitamarhi, Bihar. Closely resembles the Hariana breed but smaller. Excellent for field work.
Bachaur.diet: Paddy straw, Khesari (Lathyrus), Pulse residues, Local grazing.

Badri.description: Small hill cattle from Uttarakhand. Grazes on medicinal herbs, producing 'medicinal' quality milk. Cold tolerant.
Badri.diet: Medicinal herbs, Shrubs, Oak leaves (winter), Himalayan pasture grasses.

Bargur.description: Forest-bred cattle from Erode, Tamil Nadu. Known for speed and endurance in trotting. Semi-wild behavior.
Bargur.diet: Forest vegetation, Mountain grasses, Minimal stall feeding.

Belahi.description: Migratory breed from the foothills of Haryana. Distinctive reddish-brown color with white markings. Hardy nature.
Belahi.diet: Seasonal pastures, Forest grasses, Crop residues (during migration).

Binjharpuri.description: Native to Odisha. Medium-sized dual-purpose breed. Used extensively for paddy cultivation in wetlands.
Binjharpuri.diet: Paddy straw, Vegetable waste, Aquatic weeds, Wetland grazing.

Dagri.description: Found in Dahod, Gujarat. Mainly used for agricultural operations in hilly tribal areas. White/Grey color.
Dagri.diet: Maize stover, Forest undergrowth, Local tribal grazing lands.

Dangi.description: Draft breed from Maharashtra (Western Ghats). Unique black and white spots. Excellent for working in heavy rain/paddy fields.
Dangi.diet: Rice straw, Nachani (Finger Millet) straw, Forest grazing.

Deoni.description: Dual-purpose breed from Maharashtra/Karnataka. Resembles Gir but with black/white spots. Good milkers.
Deoni.diet: Sorghum (Jowar) straw, Cotton seed cake, Grazing.

Gangatiri.description: Native to the banks of the Ganga in UP/Bihar. Good dual-purpose breed. Very economical for small farmers.
Gangatiri.diet: Riverine grasses, Rice straw, Pulse husks, Wheat bran.

Gaolao.description: Draft breed from Wardha, Maharashtra. Historically the military breed of the Marathas. Fast runners.
Gaolao.diet: Dry grasses, Jowar/Wheat straw, Oil cakes.

Ghumusari.description: Draft breed from Odisha. Small but sturdy. Excellent for carting and ploughing in coastal/hilly areas.
Ghumusari.diet: Coastal grasses, Rice straw, Pulse residues.

Gir.description: World-famous dairy breed from Gujarat. Distinct curved forehead and long ears. High milk yield and docile nature.
Gir.diet: Green Fodder (Lucerne/Berseem), Jaggery, Cotton Seed Cake, Compound feed.

Hallikar.description: The progenitor of all Mysore breeds. Famous for long, vertical, backward-bending horns. Sprint-like speed in field work.
Hallikar.diet: Ragi straw, Rice bran, Semi-arid grazing, Horse gram.

Hariana.description: Premier dual-purpose breed from North India. Powerful work animals and fair milkers. White/Grey color.
Hariana.diet: Wheat bhusa, Green Jowar (Sorghum), Gram husk, Concentrates.

Himachali Pahari.description: Small, hardy mountain cattle from Himachal Pradesh. Sure-footed on steep slopes. High disease resistance.
Himachali Pahari.diet: Forest grazing, Tree fodder (Grewia/Ficus), Maize/Wheat stalks.

Kangayam.description: Pride of Tamil Nadu. Grey/White coat with dark markings. Known for immense strength and 'Jallikattu' cultural value.
Kangayam.diet: Sorghum, Pearl Millet, Kolu Kattai (Cenchrus ciliaris) grass.

Kankrej.description: Heaviest indigenous breed. Native to Kutch, Gujarat. Massive lyre-shaped horns. 'Sawai Chal' (unique gait).
Kankrej.diet: Semi-arid shrubs (Prosopis), Cotton seeds, Guar, Thorn forest grazing.

Kenkatha.description: Small draft breed from Bundelkhand (UP/MP). Known for thriving on poor quality feed and harsh terrain.
Kenkatha.diet: Coarse grasses, Tree leaves (Mahua), Crop residues.

Khariar.description: From Nuapada, Odisha. All-purpose breed for tribal farmers. Very low maintenance requirements.
Khariar.diet: Forest grazing (Sal leaves), Crop residues, Local vegetation.

Kherigarh.description: Draft breed from Lakhimpur Kheri, UP. Active grazers, often white in color. Good for light carting.
Kherigarh.diet: Marshland grazing, Sugarcane tops, Coarse grasses.

Khillar.description: The 'Race Car' of cattle breeds from Maharashtra. Aggressive, high energy, and extremely fast. Not for beginners.
Khillar.diet: Sugarcane tops, Maize, Jowar straw, Groundnut cake.

Kokan Kapila.description: Small cattle from Konkan region (Maharashtra/Goa). Adapted to high rainfall and rice farming. Various colors.
Kokan Kapila.diet: Western Ghats vegetation, Rice straw, Coconut waste.

Kosali.description: From Chhattisgarh. Small, sturdy, and efficient. Vital for small-scale paddy farmers.
Kosali.diet: Rice straw, Forest grass, Pulse husks.

Krishna Valley.description: Heavy draft breed from North Karnataka. Massive frame, bred for plowing sticky black cotton soil.
Krishna Valley.diet: Jowar/Maize fodder, Local grasses, Sugarcane tops.

Ladakhi.description: Native to Ladakh. Adapted to high altitude, hypobaric hypoxia, and extreme cold (-30°C). Small black/brown cattle.
Ladakhi.diet: Alfalfa (Lucerne), Willow leaves, High altitude shrubs.

Lakhimi.description: Entirely kept by small farmers in Assam. Integral to rural economy. Resistant to diverse parasites.
Lakhimi.diet: Free grazing, Rice bran, Bamboo leaves, Aquatic plants.

Malnad Gidda.description: Dwarf cattle from Karnataka's Western Ghats. Highly disease resistant. Milk is rich in medicinal properties.
Malnad Gidda.diet: Forest herbs, Medicinal plants, Green grass, Jackfruit leaves.

Malvi.description: Draft breed from Malwa, MP. White coat, strong build. Very popular for agricultural work in Central India.
Malvi.diet: Wheat straw, Soybean residue, Grazing on fallow lands.

Mewati.description: Dual purpose breed from Mewat (Rajasthan/Haryana). Docile and hard working. Good for both milk and plow.
Mewati.diet: Wheat bhusa, Mustard cake, Green fodder, Crop residues.

Motu.description: Dwarf breed from southern Odisha. Known for unique reddish-brown coat. Extremely hardy.
Motu.diet: Forest grazing, Ragi straw, Local vegetation.

Nagori.description: Famous trotting draft breed from Nagaur, Rajasthan. Agile, tall, and spirited. Used for transport.
Nagori.diet: Guar, Bajra, Moth straw, Crushed grains.

Nari.description: Migratory breed from Sirohi/Pali, Rajasthan. Dual purpose. Known for concave forehead and spiraled horns.
Nari.diet: Migratory grazing, Tree loppings (Khejri), Dry fodder.

Nimari.description: Known as the 'Khillar of MP'. Copper-red color with white splashes. Very active and aggressive draft breed.
Nimari.diet: Cotton seeds, Jowar stalks, River bank grazing.

Ongole.description: World-renowned breed from AP. Ancestor of the American Brahman. Massive, muscular, and disease resistant.
Ongole.diet: Rice straw, Groundnut haulms, Paddy bran, Green fodder.

Ponwar.description: Draft breed from Pilibhit, UP. Black and white patches. Small, compact, and active. Good for fast carting.
Ponwar.diet: Forest edge grazing, Rice straw, Agricultural waste.

Poda Thurpu.description: Draft cattle from Telangana forests. Bred by Lambada tribes. Excellent for working in deep mud/wetlands.
Poda Thurpu.diet: Forest grazing, Maize stover, Tree loppings.

Pulikulam.description: The famous 'Jallikattu' bull breed from Tamil Nadu. Grazes in large herds. Aggressive and agile.
Pulikulam.diet: Open grazing (Cenchrus ciliaris), Sorghum, Pasture lands.

Punganur.description: World's shortest humped cattle (Dwarf). Native to AP. Status symbol. Milk is extremely high in fat.
Punganur.diet: Green grass, Dry fodder, Coconut cake, Kitchen waste.

Purnea.description: Small red cattle from Purnea, Bihar. Used for plowing small holdings. Low feed requirement.
Purnea.diet: Rice straw, Jute leaves, Local grasses.

Rathi.description: Excellent dairy breed from Bikaner, Rajasthan. Called the 'Poor Man's Sahiwal'. Adaptable dual-purpose.
Rathi.diet: Moth/Guar straw, Oil cakes (Mustard), Sewan grass.

Red Kandhari.description: Draft breed from Nanded, Maharashtra. Deep brick-red color. Very uniform and attractive appearance.
Red Kandhari.diet: Sorghum straw, Cotton seed cake, Pulse residues.

Red Sindhi.description: Top-tier dairy breed. Distinct deep red color. Genetically close to Sahiwal but hardier.
Red Sindhi.diet: Dry fodder, Green grass, Rice bran, Calcium supplements.

Sahiwal.description: India's best milch breed. Loose skin ('Lola'). Sweet milk. Exceptionally calm and high yielding.
Sahiwal.diet: Wheat straw, Maize, Mustard cake, Green fodder (Berseem/Lucerne).

Shweta Kapila.description: Short, white cattle from Goa. Produces A2 milk rich in magnesium. Entirely white coat and eyes.
Shweta Kapila.diet: Coastal grasses, Jackfruit leaves, Rice gruel, Coconut waste.

Siri.description: Draught breed from Sikkim/Darjeeling. Black and white coat. Thick fur for cold protection.
Siri.diet: Alpine grasses, Tree fodder, Maize stalks.

Tharparkar.description: The 'White Pearl' of the Desert. From Jaisalmer/Kutch. Milk yield increases during drought conditions.
Tharparkar.diet: Bajra straw, Guar phalgati, Wild desert grasses (Sewan).

Thutho.description: Indigenous cattle of Nagaland. Used for meat and draft. Semi-wild management system.
Thutho.diet: Hilly jungle grazing, Forest vegetation, Bamboo leaves.

Umblachery.description: Draft breed from coastal Tamil Nadu. Calves are born red and turn grey. Resistant to marshy rot.
Umblachery.diet: Paddy straw, Rice bran, Grazing on bunds.

Vechur.description: Smallest cattle breed from Kerala. Highly valued for medicinal milk properties (easy digestibility).
Vechur.diet: Kitchen waste, Jackfruit leaves, Banana stems, Rice gruel (Kanji).
